algorithms.search

Class NearestNeighbor1D

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.search.NearestNeighbor1D

  • public class NearestNeighbor1D
extends java.lang.Object
    a nearest neighbor's algorithm using XFastTrie for predecessor and successor queries on spatially indexed numbers. The algorithm performs better on dense data (that is because the base of the prefix tree is filled, leaving smaller number of nodes to create in linear time). The queries depend upon the maximum of x to be queried. first implemented in project https://github.com/nking/curvature-scale-space-corners-and-transformations w/ Copyright (c) 2014 Climb With Your Feet and using The MIT License (MIT) then moved to this shared library project which has the same copyright
    Author:
    nichole

      best case: O(1) if key exists in the trie, else 2 * O(log_2(maxW)) where maxW is the log_2(max value).

              best case: O(1) if key exists in

     Note: maxW = 1 + Math.ceil(Math.log(maxX)/Math.log(2));

      • findClosest

        public gnu.trove.set.TIntSet findClosest(int x,
                                         int dMax)
              runtime complexity is
         best case: O(1) if key exists in
         the trie, else 2 * O(log_2(maxW)).
                     
      Note: maxW = 1 + Math.ceil(Math.log(maxX * maxY)/Math.log(2));
        Parameters:
        x -
        dMax -
        Returns:
        a set of values within dMax that are the closest points, else returns an empty set
